summary: Joseph was a Jewish man from Nazareth, married to Mary, Jesus' mother. He is considered a saint in many Christian churches, including Catholic, Orthodox, and Anglican. Known as the patron saint of workers, he is celebrated in March. Pope Pius IX named him protector of the Catholic Church. Joseph is often shown with lilies or spikenard in art. His purity is emphasized, earning him the title "most chaste." Devotion to him has grown, leading to the study of "Josephology."
title: Saint Joseph
